channel.title: Stop SyiPkpker
channel.description:
I have been trying to find a way to stop syipkpker and I have looked through forums with search button for ages :( I just can't seem to find a good solution...
But I have been thinking, all the spam syipkpker accounts on my server have had the password: Syipkpker. If it is possible to auto ipban someone for having that password it would be wonderful! Sadly I do not have the experience at coding do this kind of stuff... This is where I need help, if anyone would be so kind as to try and make a piece of code which auto ipbans anyone that joins the server with the password syipkpker it would help lots of server hosters...
Thanks in advance, Mystic0Megz

item.title: Stop SyiPkpker
item.dc:creator: @mystic0megz mystic0megz
item.description:
@mystic0megz wrote:

[quote=“dillingo, post:6, topic:289938”]This is really really simple, it stops people multi logging from spamming easily.
I have it on my server and it helps a little, so I guess I’ll share it with you.
Open up client.java and search for “yell” you’ll see something like this.

         } else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0) {

Replace it with this.

         } else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0 && starter == 1) {

What this does it make it so they have type ::starter before they can yell.

Add this to the end of your yell command.

} else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && starter == 0) { sendMessage("You need to do ::starter to yell!");
Or if you use delta, I think it would be this.

} else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && starter == 0) { sM("You need to do ::starter to yell!");[/quote]
Thank you very much
Just one problem… I put this code into my client.java and now I cant compile it anymore, I get 100 erros… I tried removing code and I still get 100 errors when compiling Any helP?

Read full topic

item.title: Stop SyiPkpker
item.dc:creator: @dillingo dillingo
item.description:
@dillingo wrote:

This is really really simple, it stops people multi logging from spamming easily.
I have it on my server and it helps a little, so I guess I’ll share it with you.
Open up client.java and search for “yell” you’ll see something like this.

         } else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0) {

Replace it with this.

         } else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0 && starter == 1) {

What this does it make it so they have type ::starter before they can yell.

Add this to the end of your yell command.

} else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && starter == 0) { sendMessage("You need to do ::starter to yell!");
Or if you use delta, I think it would be this.

} else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && starter == 0) { sM("You need to do ::starter to yell!");

Read full topic

item.title: Stop SyiPkpker
item.dc:creator: @mystic0megz mystic0megz
item.description:
@mystic0megz wrote:

dillingo:

To temporary stop it, I made it so you have to do ::starter before you can do ::yell. Your’s is a good idea though.

Would you be so kind as to share your code with me
I am a fail at coding, just managed to make a few commands, change what npcs say and added a few props

Read full topic
